comments:
When adding an external jar file to an existing Java project, the "Setting Build
Path" error dialog is displayed. The dialog displays the text "An error occured
while setting the build path. Reason:  /usr does not exist". The jar to be added
in this case is located in the /usr/local/bin/ directory. 

I am working with the release 2.1 build for linux.

Did something get dumped into the .log file (inside your workspace .metadata 
area) ?

Side question, is your workspace containing a project named 'usr' ?

From reporter:

Yes, the following is dumped in the .log in .metadata dir:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 368 Jul 07, 2003 16:18:11.154
!MESSAGE Resource /usr does not exist.


I do not have a project named usr in the workspace.

Can you give reproducable steps?
1. new java Project
2. Add _external_ JAR /usr/local/bin/xy.jar
3. press ok

My guess is that you created a project on a existing location (first page) is
that possible? It seems that this existing project contained a reference to a
folder or JAR that can't be resolved on your machine. It is a bug that the
project wizard tries to create this as a folder.
If this is what happend, you should see an entry xxx (will be created) on the
build path page. Remove this entry before pressing ok.

Bill, can you confirm that my fix in M2 solved the problem? If not, please
reopen the bug report. Thanks.
*** Bug 50733 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
